metadata.title: CVE-2024-2201 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
[x86: Native Branch History Injection]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-2201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-lowlatency - 4.15.0-226.238
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-187-generic - 5.4.0-187.207~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-187-lowlatency - 5.4.0-187.207~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1153-kvm - 4.15.0-1153.158
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-aws - 4.15.0-1169.182
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1178-azure - 4.15.0-1178.193
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1132-azure - 5.4.0-1132.139~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-gcp - 4.15.0-1163.180
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1074-ibm - 5.4.0-1074.79~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1132-oracle - 4.15.0-1132.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1126-oracle - 5.4.0-1126.135~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1111-raspi - 5.4.0-1111.123~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-226.238').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-187.207~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.182').

linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
